page.title: 04 LOCAL RETAIL PRICES
page.content: 1As part of a PRE-'A' LEVEL course in the last three weeks of term,a number of pupils looked at the spatial variation in the cost of a {BASKET OF GOODS.Nine retail outlets were sampled and for each,a list of every-day goods was drawn up.Each outlet was visited by a sixth former and the total cost was ascertained with the help of the shopkeeper.The distance of each outlet was then measured from the centre of the town and then this variable was graphed against the total cost of each basket of goods.Once the graphical exercise had been carried out,an appropriate statistical test,SPEARMAN RANK CORRELATION COEFFICIENT, was used.This revealed that the overall cost of shopping goods does in fact vary quite considerably with not only the distance from the centre of town,but also the size of the function
